channel.title: Compilers on jmmv.dev
channel.description: Recent content in Compilers on jmmv.dev

item.title: Compilers in the (BSD) base system
item.description: A commonly held axiom in the BSD community is that the C compiler belongs in the base system. “This is how things have been since the beginning of time and they define the way BSD systems are”, the proposition goes. But why is that? What makes “having a compiler in base” a BSD system? Why is the compiler a necessary part of the base system? Hold on, is it? Could we take it out?
